diagrams.title: Building Consent STRIDE diagram

data.name:
Council 
Member
data.description: Member of the council who responds to building consent application inquiries.

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: The threat of malicious actors impersonating legitimate staff members
threats.mitigation: Implement strong authentication methods for staff members to prevent unauthorized access

threats.title: Repudiation of Actions
threats.description: The threat of the staff members denying actions they took in the system
threats.mitigation: Maintain detailed logs and audit trails of staff member actions

data.name: Applicant
data.description: Individual or group submitting building consent applications.

threats.title: Repudiation of submission
threats.description: The applicant can deny their submission or actions
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging of actions taken by the applicant and ensure that audit logs cannot be tampered, or if tampered, is evident that it has been done so.

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: The threat of malicious actors impersonating legitimate applicants.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong multi-factor authentication methods, such as MFA, to verify the identity of the applicants.

data.name:
Picked up by a
council member

labels:
Picked up by a
council member

data.name:
Application
 Submission
data.description: Used to create the application and submit the application

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: Malicious actors could impersonate legitimate applicants during the application submission process
threats.mitigation: Implement strong authentication methods such as MFA (multi-factor authentication)

threats.title: Illegal Modifying
threats.description: Attackers might modify the application details or supporting documents during the submission.
threats.mitigation: Apply data integrity checks to detect any unauthorized changes in the submitted data by using digital signatures and checksums

threats.title: Repudiation of application
threats.description: Applicant may deny having submitted their application
threats.mitigation: Maintain comprehensive audit logs that capture all actions and interactions during the submission.

threats.title: Data Exposure
threats.description: Sensitive applicant information might be exposed to unauthorized parties during submission.
threats.mitigation:
* Secure the communication channel using HTTPS to encrypt data in transit.
* Use access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access the submitted data

threats.title: DDoS Attack
threats.description: Attackers could flood the application submission system with requests, causing it to become unavailable
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and CAPTCHA mechanisms to mitigate automated submission attacks.

threats.title: Elevated Privilege access
threats.description: Malicious actors could attempt to gain unauthorized access to higher privilege levels within the application
threats.mitigation: Implement a least privilege principle where users are only granted the minimal permissions necessary for their tasks.

data.name:
Application 
review
data.description: The review process of the application

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: Malicious actors could impersonate legitimate council staff members during the application review process
threats.mitigation: Implement string staff authentication methods such as MFA

threats.title: Illegal Modifying
threats.description: Attackers might modify application details or decisions during the review process.
threats.mitigation: Apply access controls and record digital signatures or timestamps on decisions to ensure their integirty.

data.name:
Unauth Council
Member
data.description: A council member who is not logged in

diagrams.description: A STRIDE diagram showcasing the threat model of the process of applying for a building consent application.
